function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Unreviewed articles","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Confounding variables impact on disease spread","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of bias in included studies","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Homogeneity in the effect of temperature and humidity on the seasonal variability and spread of the virus","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate statistical analysis compromising conclusions about the effect of temperature and humidity on virus spread","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the impact of meteorological factors on epidemic trends","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Retrospective observational studies associating weather variables with the spread of covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Heterogeneity in weather conditions beyond temperature and humidity","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Heterogeneity in data collection dates and locations","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possible inclusion of biased studies in the search results.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of study outcomes due to varying levels of evidence.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Failure to address potential conflicts and bias during study selection and evaluation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Systematic review on the emergence and replicability of the virus and its association with weather factors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Coronavirus can retain infectivity in low temperature and low humidity environment for up to 2 weeks","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Divergence in literature about the effects of temperature and humidity on the viability and transmissibility of the coronavirus","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear routes of virus transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of population density and migratory flow on transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fragility of paper signs reflecting uncertainty during pandemic","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of communication with retailers about posted signs","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited supply of professional signs due to demand and production capacity","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of follow-up research with customers to assess subjective properties of signs","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limited data collection due to covid-19 restrictions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for rapid communication during crises","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variation in regulations between geographic locations","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of readily available covid-19 content and necessary software code for digital signs","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Repurposing equipment as a coping mechanism for retailers","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of alternative contact methods for customers at closed retailers","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate crisis management planning for small retailers","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective use of digital signs by multi-location retailers during pandemic","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Informal signs conveying facts about expected behavior may not encourage compliance with public health guidelines, increasing the risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Introduction of non-local retail brands and their signage may not align with the neighborhood’s nature, potentially impacting the sense of community and local identity.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of informal signs alongside professional signs may lead to confusion and inconsistent messaging regarding social distancing measures.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continued presence of informal signs may signal a lack of standardized health and safety measures, potentially undermining public confidence in the effectiveness of the retail environment’s disease mitigation efforts.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The coexistence of informal and professional signs may create confusion and uncertainty for individuals navigating retail environments, leading to potential violations of social distancing guidelines.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited color options due to cost and availability of printers","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Miscommunication of professionalism and seriousness due to font choice","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistent compliance with government regulations due to lack of resources for smaller retailers, potentially leading to increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Informal signs used to explain the process to customers initially","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Duct tape used for marking direction of travel and indicating where to stand","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Stress reducing comprehension of new information","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Mix of informal and professional signs","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Longevity of professional signs","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of standardized signage in small businesses may result in inconsistent communication of covid-19 information to the public.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited ability of small businesses to develop visually appealing and effective signage may hamper the communication of covid-19 precautions and symptoms.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Informal signs printed in small font result in visually messy and unorganized presentation of information, increasing cognitive load on consumers.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Informal signs with general information initially provided to consumers may not effectively communicate specific social distancing rules","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Customer uncertainty due to unreadable signage and lack of clear information about open services and hours of operation","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in accessing digitized information for customers without online access","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Panic buying leading to stockouts and scarcity of essential goods","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate communication of stockout reasons to customers","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"}]}
